questions.title: Object rotation matrix to always follow a surface normal
questions.contents: Despite searching and trying everything for days now, I have a (simple?) problem I can't solve... Say I have a car going up and down hills. How would I build a 4x4 rotation matrix based on the surface normal of the landscape where the car is? Y is up and I'm not using OpenGL. I just want to apply a rotation matrix to my car's transformation matrix so it looks proper but I can't seem to be able to make such rotation matrix from a surface normal. Any help is greatly appreciated, thank you.  I've tried the following pseudo code but I'm getting weird results.
questions.author: user1

questions.title: How can i make this reset button function work?
questions.contents: I am a beginner programmer so please dont make fun of this code too much but this is a very simple weather api for practice and I just cant find a solution to make this resetFunc not be undefined/ not a function. I am loking for a way to make this function for the reset button not be undefined/ not a function. I am attempting to make this reset function resetFunc() for the resetbtn only work after the displayExecuted flag becomes true, it keeps making the newText text node undefined and ive tried with newText in global and local scope
questions.author: user2

questions.title: using table() with for loop
questions.contents: results in error 'all arguments must have the same length'. Also tried putting get(paste0('df$',i)) Is there a way to loop through these columns and tabulate?
